meanings.definition: Release from a yoke or constraint.
meanings.sent1: The farmer unyoked the oxen after a long day of plowing.
meanings.sent2: The horse was unyoked from the carriage at the end of the journey.
meanings.sent3: The students felt unyoked from stress after finishing their exams.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter unyoked the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze unyoked the kite, sending it soaring into the sky.

meanings.definition: Free from a burden or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The traveler felt unyoked after reaching the end of his journey.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the unyoked feeling of having no deadlines to meet.
meanings.sent3: The unyoked puppy happily played in the park without a care in the world.
meanings.sent4: The unyoked bird flew freely in the open sky, without any worries.
meanings.sent5: The unyoked backpack felt light as a feather on his shoulders.
